intro: Myriocarpa cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf myriocarpa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that are heart-shaped, hence its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Myriocarpa cordifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
